descr: "A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Media resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of its collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers."

fields.name: basedOn
fields.descr: "A procedure that is fulfilled in whole or in part by the creation of this media."

fields.name: type
fields.descr: "Whether the media is a photo (still image), an audio recording, or a video recording."

fields.name: _type
fields.descr: "Extensions for type"

fields.name: subtype
fields.descr: "Details of the type of the media - usually, how it was acquired (what type of device). If images sourced from a DICOM system, are wrapped in a Media resource, then this is the modality."

fields.name: view
fields.descr: "The name of the imaging view e.g. Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP)."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "Who/What this Media is a record of."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this media."

fields.name: occurrenceDateTime
fields.descr: "The date and time(s) at which the media was collected."

fields.name: _occurrenceDateTime
fields.descr: "Extensions for occurrenceDateTime"

fields.name: occurrencePeriod
fields.descr: "The date and time(s) at which the media was collected."

fields.name: operator
fields.descr: "The person who administered the collection of the image."

fields.name: reasonCode
fields.descr: "Describes why the event occurred in coded or textual form."

fields.name: bodySite
fields.descr: "Indicates the site on the subject's body where the media was collected (i.e. the target site)."

fields.name: device
fields.descr: "The device used to collect the media."

fields.name: height
fields.descr: "Height of the image in pixels (photo/video)."

fields.name: _height
fields.descr: "Extensions for height"

fields.name: width
fields.descr: "Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)."

fields.name: _width
fields.descr: "Extensions for width"

fields.name: frames
fields.descr: "The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single image, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this SHALL have a value in order to alert interface software that a multi-frame capable rendering widget is required."

fields.name: _frames
fields.descr: "Extensions for frames"

fields.name: duration
fields.descr: "The duration of the recording in seconds - for audio and video."

fields.name: _duration
fields.descr: "Extensions for duration"

fields.name: content
fields.descr: "The actual content of the media - inline or by direct reference to the media source file."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Comments made about the media by the performer, subject or other participants."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
